question_text: Why might a USB-C to HDMI adapter fail to output video despite being connected to a working HDMI display?
answer_options: USB-C does not support audio signals
HDMI requires analog passthrough via USB-C
The USB-C port does not support video alt modes
The HDMI display is not 4K compatible
correct_answer: The USB-C port does not support video alt modes
explanation: Not all USB-C ports support alternate modes like DisplayPort or HDMI. A USB-C port without video alt mode capabilities wonâ€™t transmit video.
